Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 09:01PM Chunkies wrote: Gez052, I'm sorry to hope that you're sick.  I hope it passes quickly and you'll be back to new :)  Myagirl,  I started TCx4 on 04/07/09 and I shaved my head about two weeks later on 04/24/09.  I started to shed on day 14.  It was strange since it seemed like my hair was snapping out close to the roots.  After I shaved, I would say I had about 80% of my hair left but it's been dwindling with each treatment.  At first it was really hard for me to look at myself w/o long hair but I've gotten used to it.  I'm using bandanas as well since I know I'm too lazy to take care of a wig!
Posts.Title: Does everyone loose their hair during TC chemo myagirl Sharon648

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2009 12:36PM Chunkies wrote: Hi Carole,  When I was first diagnosed, I was totally gutted when I realized that I would have to have chemo and lose my hair.  It wasn't any fun and I got through it like all of the ladies here.  I think the worse part was just waiting to lose my hair.  After that, I eventually got used to looking at my shiny  head.  I've been keeping my head covered with bandanas as I'm too lazy to maintain a wig.  Best of luck to you.  Makingway - I thought the caps weren't a guarantee that you would keep your hair.  I thought it worked by chilling the scalp which decreases blood flow to the head so your scalp won't get as much chemo.  I sucked on ice chips to try to keep away the mouth sores and it seems to hvae worked.
